original: TYRION: How long did you leave your dorm room?
translation: TYRION: 你离开宿舍有多久？

original: MIRIAM: Only for a few minutes.[p/] I try not to let my breaks go for too long.
translation: MIRIAM: 只有几分钟。[p/]我尽量不让自己休息太久。

original: TYRION: And you didn’t see the professor again after your first encounter?
translation: TYRION: 你在第一次见面后就再也没见过教授了？

original: MIRIAM: No.[p/] I did not.
translation: MIRIAM: 没有。

original: CELESTE: Her testimony seems pretty straightforward.
translation: CELESTE: 她的证词看起来很直白。

original: CELESTE: But she could still be lying…
translation: CELESTE: 但她仍可能说了谎……

original: TYRION: I’m honestly not sure…
translation: TYRION: 说实话我不确定……

original: TYRION: We’ll just have to focus on her statements about how Bellwether acted.
translation: TYRION: 我们应该专注分析那些与贝尔维瑟行为有关的证词。

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生……我没看出来这两者有什么关系。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊、[p/]哦……[p/]好像是这样的。

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega.[p/] If I recall correctly,[p/] you have a habit of getting absorbed in your work.
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士。[p/]如果我没记错，[p/]你在学习工作时全神贯注。

original: TYRION: So much so,[p/] that you’ll even lose track of the time of day.
translation: TYRION: 甚至会因过于专心致志而忘记时间。

original: MIRIAM: …Yes.[p/] But what does [i]that[/i] have to do with my testimony?
translation: MIRIAM: ……你说得对。[p/]但<u>这</u>和我的证词又有什么关系？

original: TYRION: Earlier in today’s proceedings,[p/] the prosecutor made the following argument:
translation: TYRION: 在今日庭审的早些时候，[p/]检方提出了如下主张：

original: Aria: Our first witness saw Bellwether leave the meeting with the headmaster.
translation: Aria: 第一位目击者看到了贝尔维瑟离开校长室。

original: Aria: [i]That[/i] would time this encounter around 1:00 PM.
translation: Aria: 也即<u>这次</u>目击是在下午 1:00 左右发生。

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega.[p/] If you had said “Good morning” to the professor,[p/] you would have been mistaken…
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士。[p/]如果你向教授道了“上午好”，[p/]那你可能搞错了时间……

original: TYRION: …Because that encounter could have only happened during the afternoon!
translation: TYRION: ……因为这次见面只可能发生在午后！

original: ARIA: And your point is?
translation: ARIA: 那你的重点是？

original: ARIA: You said it yourself, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] The witness simply lost track of time.
translation: ARIA: 你自己也说过了，卡斯伯特先生。[p/]这位证人只是忘记了时间。

original: TYRION: What the witness said isn’t what’s important here.
translation: TYRION: 证人说了什么并不重要。

original: TYRION: The significance is in [i]what[/i] the professor said in response.
translation: TYRION: 重要的是教授回复了<u>什么</u>。

original: TYRION: She had just come out of a meeting that was scheduled for noon.
translation: TYRION: 她刚刚结束一次预约好在正午进行的会面。

original: TYRION: She would be well aware that it was no longer morning.
translation: TYRION: 她一定会注意到已经不是早上了。

original: TYRION: So why would she respond “good morning”?
translation: TYRION: 那她又为什么会以“上午好”来回应？

original: TYRION: Wouldn’t she have corrected the witness?
translation: TYRION: 她不应该纠正一下证人吗？

original: ARIA: Their encounter was extremely short.
translation: ARIA: 她们的这次见面非常短暂。

original: ARIA: And the victim’s mind may have been preoccupied.
translation: ARIA: 而且被害人心里可能在思考其他的事情。

original: ARIA: She could have easily responded to the witness without thinking.
translation: ARIA: 她可能只是没有细想，就向证人作了同样的问候。

original: CELESTE: I’m going to be honest.[p/] I kind of agree with her.
translation: CELESTE: 说句实话，[p/]我有点认同她这个说法。

original: CELESTE: It’s not hard to believe that they were both confused about the time.
translation: CELESTE: 两个人都没注意到时间也并不难理解。

original: It’s definitely a stretch.
translation: 这么争辩是有点牵强。

original: But you still can’t shake the feeling that she’s hiding something.
translation: 但你还是难以摆脱她有所隐瞒的感觉。

original: Every time you ask her about how Bellwether acted that day,[p/] the Eye picks something up.
translation: 每当你问她贝尔维瑟当天的行为时，[p/]荷鲁斯之眼总是能看到一些东西。

original: There [i]has[/i] to be something there.
translation: 也就是说仍然<u>存在</u>内情。

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega.[p/] You haven’t been entirely truthful in your testimony, have you?
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士。[p/]你在作证时没有完全说真话，不是吗？

original: MIRIAM: T-[p/][s/]That’s absurd![p/][s/] What reason would I have to lie?! [mind="It’s such a small detail! Why does he even care?!"/]
translation: MIRIAM: 荒、[p/][s/]荒谬！[p/][s/]我为什么要说谎？！[mind="那只是个小细节而已！他为什么会在意这个？！"/]

original: Tyrion: [i]Every[/i] detail about how she acted is important, Ms. Frega.
translation: Tyrion: 她的<u>每一个</u>行为的细节都很重要，弗雷加女士。

original: Tyrion: What [i]aren't[/i] you telling us?
translation: Tyrion: 你<u>为什么</u>不告诉我们？

original: ARIA: Mr. Cuthbert,[p/] you have no basis to accuse the witness of perjury.
translation: ARIA: 卡斯伯特先生。[p/]你并没有指控证人作伪证的根据。

original: JUDGE: Y-[p/][s/]Yes![p/][s/] You will stop this at once!
translation: JUDGE: 是、[p/][s/]是的！[p/][s/]请你马上停止！

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega,[p/][s/] you're [i]lying[/i] about how Bellwether responded to your greeting, aren’t you?!
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士，[p/][s/]你<u>说谎</u>了，贝尔维瑟并不是那样回应的，对吧？！

original: MIRIAM: I-[p/][s/]I… [mind="It doesn’t make a difference… All she did was yell at me…"/]
translation: MIRIAM: 我、[p/][s/]我…… [mind="这根本无所谓吧……她只不过吼了我……"/]

original: “All she did was yell”?
translation: “她只不过吼了我”？

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega.[p/] Is it possible that Bellwether’s response was less than friendly?
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士，[p/]贝尔维瑟对你的态度是不是不怎么友好？

original: MIRIAM: W-[p/][s/]What do you care?![p/][s/] What difference does it make?! [mind="Why is he being so persistent?!"/]
translation: MIRIAM: 你、[p/][s/]你关心这个干什么？！[p/][s/]根本没所谓吧！[mind="他怎么紧咬着这一点不放？！"/]

original: TYRION: My job is to make sure [i]every[/i] part of your testimony is truthful!
translation: TYRION: 我的工作就是确保你的证言<u>句句属实</u>！

original: TYRION: Every detail matters,[p/][s/] no matter how seemingly insignificant!
translation: TYRION: 每个细节都很重要。[p/][s/]看似无关紧要的细节，也可能暗藏玄机！

original: JUDGE: Mr. Cuthbert![p/] You [i]will[/i] stop this,[p/][s/] or I will find you in contempt!
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生！[p/]你<u>如果</u>再不停止，[p/][s/]我就会判你藐视法庭罪！

original: TYRION: The professor yelled at you,[p/] didn’t she Ms. Frega?!
translation: TYRION: 教授吼了你，[p/]没错吧，弗雷加女士？！

original: MIRIAM: So what if she did?!
translation: MIRIAM: 吼了又怎么样？！

original: ARIA: …!
translation: ARIA: ……！

original: MIRIAM: E-[p/][s/]Er…[p/] I mean…
translation: MIRIAM: 呃、[p/][s/]那个……[p/]我想说的是……

original: TYRION: …I'm sorry.[p/] But there’s no going back on what you just said.
translation: TYRION: ……很抱歉，[p/]但你这话既然说出口了，就覆水难收了。

original: TYRION: So,[p/] you [i]do[/i] admit that she yelled at you.
translation: TYRION: 也就是说，[p/]你<u>承认</u>她吼过你。

original: MIRIAM: Agh![p/][s/] You impertinent little-!
translation: MIRIAM: 啊！[p/][s/]你真不要脸——！

original: MIRIAM: Yes![p/][s/] I admit it![p/][s/] The professor didn’t greet me back that day!
translation: MIRIAM: 没错！[p/][s/]我认了行吧！[p/][s/]那天，教授并没有向我问好！

original: MIRIAM: Oh.[p/] Good morning, professor.
translation: MIRIAM: 噢。[p/]上午好，教授。

original: CATHERINE: Be quiet!
translation: CATHERINE: 安静！

original: MIRIAM: …?!
translation: MIRIAM: ……？！

original: MIRIAM: She yelled at me to “Be quiet!”
translation: MIRIAM: 她吼我，让我“安静”！

original: MIRIAM: But until then we had always been nothing but courteous with each other...
translation: MIRIAM: 在此之前，我们相处一直很客气的……

original: MIRIAM: I don’t know what got into her that day…[p/] But something put her in a foul mood.
translation: MIRIAM: 也不知道她那天是遇到什么事了……[p/]惹得她一肚子邪火。

original: MIRIAM: B-[p/][s/]But that’s it![p/][s/] Everything else I said was the truth! [mind="They’ll believe me, right?!"/]
translation: MIRIAM: 只、[p/][s/]只有这一句是谎话！[p/][s/]我其余的证词千真万确！[mind="他们会相信我吧？！"/]

original: MIRIAM: I [i]did[/i] see her come out of the Headmaster’s Office and walk towards the library! [mind="That part is true!"/]
translation: MIRIAM: 我<u>的确</u>见到她离开校长室，前往图书馆！ [mind="这句是实话！"/]

original: TYRION: …!
translation: TYRION: ……！

original: So,[p/] she [i]wasn’t[/i] lying about that…
translation: 看来，[p/]她<u>并没有</u>撒谎……

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: So,[p/] is that all, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: 然后呢，[p/]卡斯伯特先生？

original: TYRION: …What do you mean, “is that all”?!
translation: TYRION: ……什么叫“然后呢”？！

original: ARIA: You badgered this witness,[p/] all so you could prove…[p/] [i]what[/i] exactly?
translation: ARIA: 你揪着证人问了半天，[p/]又能……证明[p/]<u>什么</u>呢？

original: TYRION: The witness committed perjury-
translation: TYRION: 这名证人作了伪证——

original: ARIA: The witness changed a [i]small[/i] detail of her testimony.
translation: ARIA: 证人不过是调整了证词中的一个<u>微不足道</u>的细节。

original: ARIA: A detail that is inconsequential to the case.
translation: ARIA: 这对案情没有影响。

original: ARIA: It was clearly an act with no malicious intent.
translation: ARIA: 显然，证人此举并无恶意。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: After seeing her thoughts,[p/] it’s hard to disagree with that.
translation: 读取了证人的想法后，[p/]你很难反驳这一点。

original: You were so sure that the Eye would lead you somewhere…
translation: 你之前满心以为荷鲁斯之眼能给你指条明路出来……

original: But Frega was only lying to save face.
translation: 没想到，弗雷加说谎只是因为她嫌实话丢人。

original: ARIA: The witness saw the victim leave the Headmaster’s Office and head toward the library.
translation: ARIA: 证人看到被害人离开校长室，走向图书馆。

original: ARIA: Do you have any concrete evidence to refute [i]that[/i], Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: 你能拿出具体证据反驳<u>这一点</u>吗，卡斯伯特先生？

original: TYRION: …N[p/][s/]-No…[p/] I suppose I don’t.
translation: TYRION: ……不[p/][s/]、不能……[p/]我觉得不行吧。

original: CELESTE: W-[p/][s/]Wait![p/][s/] Is this really okay?!
translation: CELESTE: 等、[p/][s/]等一下！[p/][s/]就这么算了吗？！

original: CELESTE: At this rate,[p/][s/] this will be the only chance you have to cross-examine her!
translation: CELESTE: 这样下去，[p/][s/]你之后再也没机会对她进行交叉询问了啊！

original: TYRION: I don’t think she’s lying anymore…
translation: TYRION: 我不觉得她还在撒谎……

original: Tyrion: And I was really pushing my luck earlier...
translation: Tyrion: 我刚才太冒进了……

original: TYRION: If I continue pressing her,[p/] the judge might [i]actually[/i] charge me with contempt...
translation: TYRION: 我要是再追问下去，[p/]法官恐怕<u>真的要</u>指控我藐视法庭了……

original: But if Miriam isn’t the one that’s lying,[p/] then…
translation: 如果米莉亚姆没有说谎，[p/]那么……

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: TYRION: The defense has no further questions for the witness, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: TYRION: 辩方对证人没有其他疑问了，斯蒂尔文德检察官。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: The prosecutor stays silent for a while.
translation: 检察官沉默了一会儿。

original: She almost looks…[p/] disappointed.
translation: 她的表情……[p/]堪称失望。

original: ARIA: Very well.[p/] Miriam,[p/] you are dismissed.
translation: ARIA: 好吧。[p/]米莉亚姆，[p/]你可以离开了。

original: MIRIAM: Hmph…
translation: MIRIAM: 哼……

original: Miriam still looks like she’s fuming.[p/] But she leaves the room without protest.
translation: 米莉亚姆依旧一副气哼哼的样子。[p/]不过她还是老老实实地走出了法庭。

original: JUDGE: …
translation: JUDGE: ……

original: The judge breathes a sigh of relief as the young noble is escorted out of the room.
translation: 见到年轻贵族在护送下离开法庭，法官松了口气。

original: ARIA: Now with that out of the way…[p/] What else do you have, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: 对这位证人的询问结束了……[p/]你还有什么新招吗，卡斯伯特先生？

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: The only way to refute the prosecutor’s theory is to cast doubt on one of the witnesses.
translation: 想反驳检方的主张只有一个办法，那就是证明其中一名证人很可疑。

original: If it wasn’t Miriam, then…
translation: 既然米莉亚姆没问题，接下来……

original: TYRION: Steelwind.[p/] To test your theory,[p/] we must question every witness that saw the victim that day.
translation: TYRION: 斯蒂尔文德。[p/]为了验证你的主张，[p/]我们必须询问每一名目击到被害人的证人。

original: TYRION: So, with that said…[p/] the defense would like to call Jan Hughes to the stand.
translation: TYRION: 因此……[p/]辩方希望传唤简·休斯出庭作证。

original: ARIA: …I hope you understand, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: ARIA: ……我希望你能明白一点，卡斯伯特先生。

original: ARIA: Your entire case rests on the assumption that one of the witness accounts is incorrect.
translation: ARIA: 你想翻盘，前提是其中一名证人的证词有误。

original: ARIA: If your cross-examination of Mr. Hughes leads nowhere,[p/] then I hope you’re ready to concede.
translation: ARIA: 如果对休斯先生的交叉询问也没有揭示新情报，[p/]届时希望你做好认输的准备。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: You don’t like the sound of it,[p/] but she’s right.
translation: 这话听得你难受，[p/]但她说得没错。

original: Unless you can find…[p/][s/] [i]something[/i] in Jan’s testimony,[p/] you won’t really have anything to disprove her theory.
translation: 除非在简的证词中找出[p/][s/]<u>一线生机</u>，[p/]否则你的确无法反驳她的主张。

original: ARIA: Bailiff.[p/] Please bring in Mr. Hughes.
translation: ARIA: 法警，[p/]请将休斯先生带入法庭。

original: ARIA: Witness,[p/] please state your name and occupation for the courtroom.
translation: ARIA: 证人，[p/]请你向法庭陈述你的姓名与职业。

original: JAN: …
translation: JAN: ……

original: ARIA: Witness![p/][s/] Name and occupation!
translation: ARIA: 证人！[p/][s/]陈述姓名与职业！

original: JAN: A-[p/][s/]Ah,[p/][s/] right.
translation: JAN: 啊、[p/][s/]啊，[p/][s/]明白。

original: JAN: My name is Jan Hughes.[p/] I’m on the cleaning staff of the academy.
translation: JAN: 我叫简·休斯，[p/]是学院的清洁工。

original: ARIA: …Mr. Hughes,[p/] please testify to the court about your encounter with the professor that day.
translation: ARIA: ……休斯先生，[p/]请你就当天与教授的相遇向法院作证。

original: JAN: …Sure.
translation: JAN: ……好。

original: Jan: I saw the professor when I was cleaning the west-wing hallways.[p/] It was about 20-30 minutes before the body was discovered.
translation: Jan: 我是在清理西侧走廊的时候看到教授的，[p/]当时大概是在发现尸体的 20 到 30 分钟之前。

original: Jan: She walked by me…[p/] But she looked pretty out of it.
translation: Jan: 她从我身旁走过……[p/]但她看起来十分不正常。

original: Jan: I heard she was undead when this happened…[p/] Pretty creepy if you ask me.
translation: Jan: 事发后听说她当时已经是僵尸一样的生物了……[p/]真把我吓坏了。

original: Jan: After that,[p/] she went into the empty classroom.
translation: Jan: 在那之后，[p/]她进了一间空教室。

original: TYRION: Well...[p/] That was…[p/] straightforward.
translation: TYRION: 好吧……[p/]这证言……[p/]很直白清晰。

original: CELESTE: Come on, Jan![p/][s/] What are we supposed to do with that?!
translation: CELESTE: 别这样，简！[p/][s/]你这样我们怎么办呀？！

original: JAN: I don’t know.[p/] [i]You[/i] guys are the lawyers.
translation: JAN: 我怎么知道，[p/]<u>你们</u>才是律师。

original: JAN: I’m just telling you what I saw.
translation: JAN: 我只是把我看到的说出来而已。

original: JUDGE: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] You may begin your cross-examination.
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生，[p/]你可以开始交叉询问了。

original: TYRION: How are you so sure that it was 30 minutes before?
translation: TYRION: 你为什么如此确定是 30 分钟前？

original: JAN: I always check the time to make sure I’m on schedule.
translation: JAN: 我经常确认时间，来保证自己按时间表进行工作。

original: JAN: I was supposed to finish cleaning the halls by 3:00 pm.
translation: JAN: 我本应在下午 3:00 完成大厅的清理工作。

original: :Right…[p/] The body was discovered at 3:04 PM.
translation: :没错……[p/]尸体被发现的时间是下午 3:04。

original: ARIA: What was the "professor" like, Mr. Hughes?
translation: ARIA: 休斯先生，“教授”当时什么样子？

original: TYRION: Did anything else look off about her?
translation: TYRION: 她看起来有什么不对劲的地方吗？

original: JAN: I mean…[p/] yeah.[p/] She [i]was[/i] an undead after all.
translation: JAN: 我意思是……[p/]嗯，[p/]她当时毕竟已经是个僵尸了。

original: TYRION: That remains to be proven.
translation: TYRION: 这一点还有待证明。

original: JAN: If you say so…
translation: JAN: 你这么说也行吧……

original: TYRION: Anyways,[p/] what was her demeanor like?
translation: TYRION: 总之，[p/]她当时的神态举止如何？

original: Jan: She looked like she was in a bad mood.
translation: Jan: 她当时看起来心情不太好。

original: Jan: Either that or she was tired.
translation: Jan: 或者说她很累。

original: Jan: But I guess she was just dead inside…[p/] literally.
translation: Jan: 不过我觉得她的心已经死了……[p/]字面意思。

original: TYRION: Did you see anyone else enter that classroom?
translation: TYRION: 你有看见别人进那间教室吗？

original: JAN: I’m honestly not sure.[p/] I wasn't paying much attention to her.
translation: JAN: 我不太确定。[p/]我没太注意她。

original: JAN: I [i]did[/i] think it was weird that she went in there.
translation: JAN: 我当时<u>确实</u>觉得她进那间教室很奇怪。

original: JAN: With the funky smell,[p/] I can't think of why anyone would go there willingly.
translation: JAN: 教室里味道那么难闻，[p/]真不敢想什么样的人才会主动进去。

original: Right.[p/] The headmaster's mistake put a rancid smell in that room.
translation: 没错，[p/]校长的失误导致那间教室里充满了恶臭。

original: CELESTE: He’s not giving us a lot to work with…
translation: CELESTE: 他的证言没留给我们什么突破口……

original: TYRION: He tends to leave out details unless we directly ask him about it.
translation: TYRION: 除非我们主动问他，不然他会在证言里遗漏很多细节。

original: TYRION: I just need to ask him the right questions.
translation: TYRION: 只要问对问题就好。

original: TYRION: Maybe we can pull more information out of him.
translation: TYRION: 或许能从他身上获取更多信息。

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生……我没看出来这两者有什么关系。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊、[p/]哦……[p/]好像是这样的。

original: TYRION: I believe you’ve forgotten a few details about what the professor did.
translation: TYRION: 有关教授当时的所作所为，我想你漏掉了一些细节。

original: JAN: Yeah…?
translation: JAN: 啊……？

original: Jan: Sorry,[p/] it’s hard to remember these things sometimes…
translation: Jan: 抱歉，[p/]有些时候我记不清这些事……

original: Which detail should you ask him for?
translation: 该问他哪条细节呢？

original: Did she do anything to you?
translation: 她有对你做什么吗？

original: TYRION: Did she interact with you at all?
translation: TYRION: 她和你有过互动吗？

original: JAN: Oh…[p/] yeah…
translation: JAN: 哦……[p/]对……

original: JAN: I didn’t notice her at first and I accidentally got in her way.
translation: JAN: 我最开始没注意到她，不小心挡了她的路。

original: JAN: She shoved me to the side and kept walking forward.
translation: JAN: 她把我推到一边然后继续往前走。

original: Did she touch anything?
translation: 她有碰到什么吗？

original: TYRION: Did she touch anything?
translation: TYRION: 她有碰到什么东西吗？

original: JAN: Oh…[p/] yeah…
translation: JAN: 哦……[p/]有的……

original: JAN: She knocked over a vase and shattered it.
translation: JAN: 她撞倒了一个花瓶，那个花瓶摔碎了。

original: JAN: It [i]might[/i] have been an accident…[p/] But she’s done stuff like that on purpose before.
translation: JAN: 本来这<u>可能</u>是个意外……[p/]但是她以前也故意做过类似的事情。

original: Did she make any sounds?
translation: 她有发出什么声音吗？

original: TYRION: Did you hear her make any sounds?
translation: TYRION: 你有听到她发出什么声音吗？

original: JAN: Oh…[p/] Yeah…
translation: JAN: 哦……[p/]对……

original: JAN: After she knocked over the vase,[p/] she yelled at me to [s/]“Be Quiet!”.
translation: JAN: 她撞倒花瓶之后，[p/]朝我大喊[s/]“安静！”。

original: JAN: …But I didn’t even say anything.
translation: JAN: ……但我当时一个字都没说。

original: TYRION: This detail could be extremely important.
translation: TYRION: 这个细节可能至关重要。

original: TYRION: Please add it to your testimony, Mr. Hughes.
translation: TYRION: 请将此加到你的证言里，休斯先生。

original: JAN: Whatever you say, man…
translation: JAN: 随便啦……

original: TYRION: Mr. Hughes.[p/] You said that Bellwether yelled at you.
translation: TYRION: 休斯先生。[p/]你有提到贝尔维瑟向你吼过。

original: TYRION: What were her exact words?
translation: TYRION: 她朝你吼了什么？

original: JAN: Uh…[p/] I think she yelled at me to “Be Quiet!”.
translation: JAN: 唔……[p/]我记得她朝我吼道“安静！”。

original: ARIA: What...?
translation: ARIA: 什么……？

original: JAN: I thought it was weird.[p/] I didn’t even say anything.
translation: JAN: 我感觉很怪，[p/]因为当时我什么都没说。

original: JAN: But I know better than to talk back to her.
translation: JAN: 但我知道最好别顶嘴。

original: TYRION: That’s the thing, Hughes.
translation: TYRION: 就是这个！休斯先生。

original: Tyrion: The prosecution’s theory is as such:
translation: Tyrion: 检方的理论如下：

original: TYRION: The professor was murdered in the library and was reanimated using [b]Animate Corpse[/b].
translation: TYRION: 教授在图书馆被杀害，有人对尸体用了[b]活化死尸[/b]。

original: TYRION: With a quick [b]illusion[/b] spell,[p/] no one would notice that she was undead.
translation: TYRION: 在某种[b]幻象术[/b]的伪装下，[p/]没人会注意到她是死尸。

original: TYRION: However,[p/][s/] if what you saw was [i]truly[/i] the undead Bellwether…
translation: TYRION: 不过，[p/][s/]如果你见到的<u>真的是</u>活尸贝尔维瑟的话……

original: TYRION: …How did she speak to you?!
translation: TYRION: ……她怎么可能和你说话？！

original: JAN: Huh…?
translation: JAN: 哈……？

original: ARIA: This…[p/][s/] doesn’t make any sense!
translation: ARIA: 这……[p/][s/]这根本说不通！

original: TYRION: Mr. Hughes,[p/] undead can follow simple orders but they don’t have the intelligence to speak.
translation: TYRION: 休斯先生，[p/]虽然活尸能遵从简单的命令，但它们没有足够的智力来说话。

original: ARIA: Perhaps…[p/][s/] the witness was mistaken!
translation: ARIA: 或许……[p/][s/]是证人记错了！

original: JAN: N-[p/][s/]No![p/][s/] I’m sure I heard her yell at me!
translation: JAN: 不、[p/][s/]不是这样的！[p/][s/]我很清楚地记得她朝我吼过！

original: JAN: I remembered because what she said didn’t make any sense!
translation: JAN: 因为她吼得我一头雾水，所以我记得很清楚！

original: TYRION: Exactly![p/][s/] He didn’t say anything,[p/] but she still yelled at him to “Be quiet!”.
translation: TYRION: 正是如此！[p/][s/]他什么都没说，[p/]但她仍旧吼了“安静！”。

original: …Wait a minute.
translation: ……等下。

original: JUDGE: I’m…[p/] afraid I don’t understand.
translation: JUDGE: 我……[p/]怕是不太明白。

original: JUDGE: We’ve already established that the victim was dead long before her encounter with Mr. Hughes.
translation: JUDGE: 我们已经确定，死者在遇到休斯先生之前就已经死了。

original: JUDGE: But…[p/] if what he saw wasn’t an undead,[p/][s/] what was it?
translation: JUDGE: 但……[p/]如果他所见的教授并非活尸，[p/][s/]那会是什么呢？

original: ARIA: It [i]had[/i] to be an undead!
translation: ARIA: 那<u>肯定</u>是个活尸！

original: Aria: What other explanation is there?!
translation: Aria: 不然还有什么解释？！

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: It couldn’t have been a [b]Major Illusion[/b].
translation: 不可能是[b]高等幻象术[/b]。

original: Otherwise,[p/] it wouldn’t have been able to shove Jan out of the way or knock over the vase.
translation: 否则，[p/]她当时也不可能把简推开或者撞倒花瓶。

original: Whatever it was,[p/] someone probably used [b]Illusory Disguise[/b] to make it look like Bellwether.
translation: 无论那是什么，[p/]某人可能用了[b]幻象伪装[/b]来假扮贝尔维瑟。

original: Does that mean it was a person?
translation: 是不是意味着那是个人呢？

original: No…[p/] If it was a person,[p/] how did Bellwether’s body end up in the lecture hall?
translation: 不对……[p/]如果是人假扮的话，[p/]那又如何解释贝尔维瑟的尸体在讲堂呢？

original: Bellwether wouldn’t have been able to turn herself invisible if she was dead.
translation: 如果贝尔维瑟死了，她也没办法隐身。

original: And whatever Jan saw,[p/] it needs to be something that could have transported Bellwether’s body unseen.
translation: 无论简看到了什么，[p/]一定得是某种能不被人发现，并转移贝尔维瑟尸体的东西。

original: It would have also needed to have a mass [i]and[/i] the ability to speak.
translation: 同时也得有实体<u>和</u>说话的能力。

original: Or at the very least,[p/] it needs to be something that can recreate Bellwether’s voice.
translation: 或者说至少得是某种能模仿贝尔维瑟声音的东西。

original: What could have done that?
translation: 什么东西能满足这些条件呢？

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: There has to [i]something[/i] you've seen that could have recreated Bellwether's voice.
translation: 你一定见过能模仿贝尔维瑟声音的<u>什么东西</u>。

original: TYRION: …!
translation: TYRION: ……！

original: TYRION: That’s it!
translation: TYRION: 就是这个！

original: ARIA: …!
translation: ARIA: ……！

original: JUDGE: Do you have an answer for us, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生，你有答案了吗？

original: JUDGE: What did the witness actually see?!
translation: JUDGE: 证人当时看到的到底是什么？！

original: TYRION: Your Honor.[p/] The witness didn’t actually hear the dead victim speaking.
translation: TYRION: 法官阁下，[p/]证人听见的并不是受害者的尸体在说话。

original: TYRION: What he [i]actually[/i] heard was her voice being recreated using magic.
translation: TYRION: 他听到的受害者的声音<u>其实</u>是魔法模拟出来的。

original: ARIA: Are you trying to say that her voice was recreated using a spell…?
translation: ARIA: 你难不成要说她的声音是通过某种法术模拟出来的……？

original: TYRION: Not a spell, Steelwind.[p/] It was artificery.
translation: TYRION: 不是法术，斯蒂尔文德。[p/]是奥术装置。

original: TYRION: And whoever the murderer is,[p/] they had the perfect piece of artificery available to them.
translation: TYRION: 无论真凶是谁，[p/]学院里都有完美的奥术装置供其使用。

original: TYRION: One programmed with Catherine Bellwether’s voice.
translation: TYRION: 一个集成了凯瑟琳·贝尔维瑟的声音的奥术装置。

original: ARIA: …!
translation: ARIA: ……！

original: Aria: You can’t possibly mean-!
translation: Aria: 难不成是——！

original: TYRION: That’s right, Steelwind!
translation: TYRION: 没错，斯蒂尔文德！

original: TYRION: What Mr. Hughes saw was an Arcane Construct!
translation: TYRION: 休斯先生当时看到的是一个奥术构造体！

original: JUDGE: An “Arcane Construct”?
translation: JUDGE: 一个“奥术构造体”？

original: TYRION: Think of it as a magically animated suit of armor, Your Honor.
translation: TYRION: 请把它当成一个由魔法驱动的全套盔甲，法官阁下。

original: JUDGE: But we ruled out such a possibility, hadn’t we?
translation: JUDGE: 但我们排除了这种可能性，不是吗？

original: JUDGE: Construct or not,[p/] no one could disguise themselves [i]and[/i] carry the body to the classroom.
translation: JUDGE: 无论是不是奥术构造体，[p/]都没人能在用法术伪装自己的同时，把尸体搬到教室。

original: TYRION: A person wouldn’t have been able to do it…
translation: TYRION: 一个人确实做不到……

original: TYRION: But Arcane Constructs are a different thing entirely.
translation: TYRION: 但奥术构造体就另说了。

original: TYRION: Those suits of armor are extremely large.[p/] But more importantly,[p/][s/] they’re hollow!
translation: TYRION: 那些盔甲非常大，[p/]更重要的是，[p/][s/]它们是中空的！

original: JUDGE: I see…
translation: JUDGE: 我明白了……

original: JUDGE: That means that theoretically,[p/] someone could have placed the victim’s body inside it...
translation: JUDGE: 理论上来说，[p/]某人很可能把受害者的尸体放在里面……

original: TYRION: The Arcane Construct wouldn’t [i]just[/i] transport the body.
translation: TYRION: 奥术构造体<u>不只是</u>转移尸体。

original: TYRION: With an [b]Illusory Disguise[/b],[p/] it would also confuse and mislead anyone who saw it!
translation: TYRION: 通过[b]幻象伪装[/b]，[p/]它还能误导所有看见它的人！

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: I commend your deduction, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] I would have never considered that possibility.
translation: ARIA: 你的推理很精彩，卡斯伯特先生，[p/]我从未想过这种可能性。

original: ARIA: It’s certainly plausible,[p/] but what does this prove exactly?
translation: ARIA: 听起来很有可能，[p/]但这证明了什么？

original: TYRION: It proves that the body wasn’t animated using [b]necromancy[/b].
translation: TYRION: 这证明了尸体没有被[b]死灵术[/b]活化。

original: TYRION: My client isn’t the murderer!
translation: TYRION: 我的委托人不是凶手！

original: ARIA: The defendant is still capable of performing all of the acts that you described.
translation: ARIA: 被告仍然具备能力实施这些行动。

original: ARIA: His [b]Compendium[/b] contains [b]Illusory Disguise[/b] after all.
translation: ARIA: 毕竟他的[b]法术汇编[/b]包含[b]幻象伪装[/b]。

original: TYRION: There were several students in the library that day.
translation: TYRION: 案发当天图书馆有许多学生。

original: TYRION: [i]Any[/i] of them could have committed the murder!
translation: TYRION: 他们中的<u>任何一个</u>都有可能实施犯罪！

original: ARIA: One [i]might[/i] come to that conclusion,[p/] if they didn’t have one crucial piece of evidence.
translation: ARIA: 如果没有关键性的证据的话，[p/]是有可能得出这样的结论。

original: ARIA: I’d like to present a new piece of evidence to the court.
translation: ARIA: 我想向法庭出示新证据。

original: From under her table,[p/] you see Ms. Steelwind pull out the bloody rapier.
translation: 你看到斯蒂尔文德从桌子下拿出了一把沾血的刺剑。

original: JUDGE: Blood…[p/][s/] I-[p/][s/]Is that…?!
translation: JUDGE: 血迹……[p/][s/]那、[p/][s/]那难道就是……？！

original: ARIA: Yes, Your Honor.
translation: ARIA: 没错，法官阁下。

original: ARIA: [i]This[/i] is the murder weapon.
translation: ARIA: <u>这</u>就是凶器。

original: CELESTE: Ugh…[p/] She was saving that for the perfect moment, wasn’t she?
translation: CELESTE: 呃啊……[p/]她可真会伺机而动。

original: ARIA: This rapier was reported stolen by Miriam Frega weeks before the murder.
translation: ARIA: 在谋杀发生几周前，米莉亚姆·弗雷加通报称这把刺剑失窃。

original: ARIA: And during the investigation,[p/] it was finally found…
translation: ARIA: 在调查过程中，[p/]它是在……

original: ARIA: …in the defendant’s locker.
translation: ARIA: ……被告的储物柜里找到的。

original: TYRION: W-[p/][s/]Wait!
translation: TYRION: 等、[p/][s/]等下！

original: ARIA: He was clearly trying to use one of her possessions in a paltry attempt to frame her.
translation: ARIA: 显然被告想利用米莉亚姆的所有物来陷害她。

original: ARIA: Why…[p/] he even stole her locker’s nameplate and placed it over his.
translation: ARIA: 他甚至……[p/]偷换了自己和弗雷加女士储物柜的名牌。

original: TYRION: …!
translation: TYRION: ……！

original: Damn it…[p/][s/] That’s [i]not[/i] what happened!
translation: 可恶……[p/][s/]事情<u>不是</u>这样的！

original: But honestly...[p/] it sounds more plausible than what [i]really[/i] took place…
translation: 但说实话……[p/]这听起来比<u>实际</u>发生的要可信得多……

original: CELESTE: …We’re basically back to square one, aren’t we?
translation: CELESTE: ……我们基本是又回到了起点，不是吗？

original: CELESTE: Anyone could have told that Construct to do all those things.
translation: CELESTE: 谁都能让那些奥术构造体去做这些事。

original: Wait…[p/] “Anyone”?[p/] Is that really true?
translation: 等下……[p/]“谁都能”？[p/]真的谁都可以吗？

original: The Construct transported the professor’s body.[p/] And someone used an [b]illusion[/b] to make it look like her.
translation: 奥术构造体搬运了教授的尸体，[p/]还被人用[b]幻象术[/b]伪装成贝尔维瑟的样子。

original: They even used a pre-recorded voice to make the illusion more convincing…
translation: 甚至用了提前录制好的声音，来使幻象更加可信……

original: Could [i]anyone[/i] have done that?
translation: 有<u>谁</u>能做到这一点呢？

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: The Constructs are available to the students.[p/] But not all of their functions are enabled.
translation: 学生们也可以用那些构造体，[p/]但不是所有的功能都对学生开放。

original: Who would have every function available to them?
translation: 谁会有完整的使用权限呢？

original: Several memories flood back to you.
translation: 些许记忆涌向你的脑海。

original: TYRION: Mr. Hughes.[p/] You said that Bellwether yelled at you.
translation: TYRION: 休斯先生。[p/]你有提到贝尔维瑟向你吼过。

original: TYRION: What were her exact words?
translation: TYRION: 她朝你吼了什么？

original: JAN: Uh…[p/] I think she yelled at me to “be quiet”.
translation: JAN: 唔……[p/]我记得她朝我吼道“安静！”。

original: MIRIAM: She yelled at me to “Be quiet!”
translation: MIRIAM: 她吼我，让我“安静”！

original: MIRIAM: But until then we had always been nothing but courteous with each other...
translation: MIRIAM: 在此之前，我们相处一直很客气的……

original: MIRIAM: I don’t know what got into her that day…[p/] But something put her in a foul mood.
translation: MIRIAM: 也不知道她那天是遇到什么事了……[p/]惹得她一肚子邪火。

original: Catherine: Be quiet!
translation: Catherine: 安静！

original: TYRION: S-[p/][s/]Sorry!
translation: TYRION: 抱、[p/][s/]抱歉！

original: Catherine: BE QUIET!
translation: Catherine: <size=1.5em>安静！</size>

original: Eris begins giggling.[p/] She seems amused by what’s happening.
translation: 厄莉斯咯咯笑了起来，[p/]似乎觉得这一出很滑稽。

original: ERIS: The construct’s “voice” is just a series of pre-recorded messages.
translation: ERIS: 奥术构造体的“声音”只是一系列提前录制好的片段。

original: ERIS: I’m not sure if you noticed,[p/] but it uses the voice of Professor Bellwether.
translation: ERIS: 不知道你有没有注意到，[p/]它用的是贝尔维瑟教授的声音。

original: ERIS: Unfortunately,[p/] you can’t make them say anything other than what’s recorded.
translation: ERIS: 不过遗憾的是，[p/]它们只能说那些提前录制好的语句。

original: ERIS: Only the headmaster can change those settings.
translation: ERIS: 只有校长能更改这些设定。

original: TYRION: No…![p/][s/] It can’t be him!
translation: TYRION: 不……！[p/][s/]不可能会是他！

original: CELESTE: What is it, Tyrion?!
translation: CELESTE: 怎么了，提利昂？！

original: CELESTE: Did you figure something out?!
translation: CELESTE: 你弄明白什么东西了吗？！

original: TYRION: I-[p/]I…[p/] did.
translation: TYRION: 我、[p/]我……[p/]明白了。

original: But is [i]he[/i] seriously the one behind all of this?
translation: 但<u>他</u>真的会是幕后黑手吗？

original: TYRION: …Ms. Steelwind.[p/] Earlier you said that my client could have orchestrated this entire ruse.
translation: TYRION: ……斯蒂尔文德女士。[p/]先前你提到我的委托人也能自导自演这一切。

original: TYRION: But that’s simply not true.
translation: TYRION: 但这是不可能的。

original: ARIA: How so?[p/] Anyone could have ordered the Construct to carry out the victim’s body.
translation: ARIA: 怎么会？[p/]谁都能命令奥术构造体搬运死者的尸体。

original: TYRION: Yes.[p/] But not everyone can [i]change[/i] what the Constructs are able to say.
translation: TYRION: 这确实不假，[p/]但不是所有人都有权限<u>更改</u>构造体能说的话。

original: TYRION: Only one individual has the credentials for that…
translation: TYRION: 只有一个人有权限做到这一点……

original: TYRION: Theodore Redmond:[p/] Headmaster of the Imperial Academy!
translation: TYRION: 那就是西奥多·雷德蒙，[p/]帝国学院的校长！

original: CELESTE: Wait,[p/][s/] you’re not serious, are you?!
translation: CELESTE: 等下，[p/][s/]你不是认真的吧？！

original: CELESTE: You think the [i]headmaster[/i] did all this?!
translation: CELESTE: 你认为<u>校长</u>是幕后黑手？！

original: TYRION: I…[p/] don’t want to believe it.
translation: TYRION: 我……[p/]我也不想相信是他。

original: TYRION: But he’s the only person who [i]could[/i] have done it.
translation: TYRION: 但他是唯一一个<u>能做到</u>这些事的人。

original: ARIA: That’s completely ridiculous!
translation: ARIA: 这太荒谬了！

original: ARIA: Headmaster Redmond would [i]never[/i] do something like this!
translation: ARIA: 雷德蒙校长<u>绝不是</u>会做这种事情的人！

original: TYRION: Ms. Steelwind,[p/] there’s one common element between each of the witness’ encounters with Bellwether.
translation: TYRION: 斯蒂尔文德，[p/]每次证人与贝尔维瑟接触时都有一个共同点。

original: TYRION: It’s what Bellwether said to them.
translation: TYRION: 就是贝尔维瑟对他们说的话。

original: ARIA: …!
translation: ARIA: ……！

original: ARIA: She yelled at both of them to “Be quiet!”…
translation: ARIA: 她对遇到的所有的人都说了“安静”……

original: TYRION: Miriam Frega was particularly surprised.
translation: TYRION: 米莉亚姆·弗雷加对此特别惊讶。

original: TYRION: She had a good relationship with the professor.
translation: TYRION: 她与教授关系不错。

original: TYRION: But when greeted by the professor,[p/] Bellwether just shouted at her.
translation: TYRION: 但当她向教授问候时，[p/]贝尔维瑟却吼了回去。

original: TYRION: …Almost as if the professor was responding indiscriminately.
translation: TYRION: ……仿佛教授是在不分对象的进行回答。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: TYRION: And recall her encounter with Jan Hughes.
translation: TYRION: 也请回忆一下她遇到简·休斯的时候。

original: TYRION: The professor knocked over a vase and shouted at him to "Be quiet!" immediately after.
translation: TYRION: 教授撞倒了花瓶，然后立刻朝着休斯先生吼道“安静！”

original: TYRION: Even though he hadn’t said anything.
translation: TYRION: 但当时休斯先生一个字都没说。

original: CELESTE: …She was responding to the sound of the vase breaking!
translation: CELESTE: ……她当时是在回应花瓶碎掉的声音！

original: TYRION: Now let me ask you this, Steelwind.
translation: TYRION: 现在让我问问你，斯蒂尔文德。

original: TYRION: Where did Bellwether come from [i]before[/i] she encountered Ms. Frega and Mr. Hughes?
translation: TYRION: 在遇到弗雷加女生和休斯先生<u>之前</u>，贝尔维瑟是从哪里走过来的？

original: ARIA: Her meeting…
translation: ARIA: 她和校长……

original: TYRION: …With the headmaster.
translation: TYRION: ……的会议。

original: JUDGE: It appears that the defense truly means to indict Theodore Redmond.
translation: JUDGE: 看来辩方真心打算起诉西奥多·雷德蒙。

original: JUDGE: If so,[p/] we have no choice but to take a brief recess until he can be brought here.
translation: JUDGE: 这样的话，[p/]我们别无选择，只能在他被护送至此之前短暂休庭。

original: Theodore: There’s no need.
translation: Theodore: 没有休庭的必要。

original: THEODORE: Fortunately for you,[p/] I’m already in the gallery.
translation: THEODORE: 你们很幸运，[p/]因为我就在旁听席。

original: The headmaster stood up from the gallery seats behind you and slowly walked onto the witness stand.
translation: 校长从你身后的旁观席上站起身，并慢慢地走上证人席。

original: …Has he been here the entire time?!
translation: ……他原来一直都在这？！

original: THEODORE: Now…[p/] please correct me if I’m wrong, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: THEODORE: 现在……[p/]如果我说的有问题，请纠正我，卡斯伯特先生。

original: THEODORE: But do you think [i]I[/i] am the one who committed this crime?
translation: THEODORE: 但你认为<u>我</u>是本案真凶？

original: TYRION: …I’m sorry, Redmond.
translation: TYRION: ……我很抱歉，雷德蒙校长。

original: TYRION: But no matter how I look at it,[p/] everything I’ve found points to you.
translation: TYRION: 无论我怎么看，[p/]一切的证据都指向你。

original: THEODORE: No.[p/] There’s no need to apologize.
translation: THEODORE: 嗯，[p/]没必要道歉。

original: THEODORE: In fact,[p/] I should commend you on the lengths that you’re going to defend dear Wallace.
translation: THEODORE: 实际上，[p/]我应该向你为华莱士辩护到这一步致谢。

original: ARIA: …The court appreciates your understanding, Mr. Redmond.
translation: ARIA: ……法庭感谢你的理解，雷德蒙先生。

original: THEODORE: ...
translation: THEODORE: ……

original: THEODORE: Now then…[p/] To clear the air,[p/] I suppose I should give [i]my[/i] testimony on what happened that day.
translation: THEODORE: 好了……[p/]为了消除误会，[p/]<u>我</u>应该向法庭陈述那天发生了什么。

original: Theodore: That day,[p/] I had a meeting scheduled with the professor at noon.
translation: Theodore: 那天，[p/]我和教授约好在中午见面。

original: Theodore: She showed up at the expected time,[p/] and we discussed various administrative matters.
translation: Theodore: 她准时到场，[p/]我们一起探讨了许多管理方面的事项。

original: Theodore: Our meeting went on for an hour.[p/] After which, she left to prepare for her next class.
translation: Theodore: 我们的会谈持续了一小时，[p/]在那之后，她便离开去准备下一堂课。

original: Theodore: Despite our many disagreements,[p/] we still knew how to be civil with one another.
translation: Theodore: 虽然有许多分歧，[p/]但我们都知道尊重对方。

original: Theodore: After all,[p/] I had no reason to bear a personal grudge against her.
translation: Theodore: 毕竟，[p/]我没有理由对她怀恨在心。

original: CELESTE: I…[p/] just can’t see it.
translation: CELESTE: 我……[p/]我就是不理解。

original: CELESTE: He seems like such a nice person.
translation: CELESTE: 他看起来是个很好的人。

original: CELESTE: Is he [i]really[/i] the person we’re looking for?
translation: CELESTE: 他<u>真的</u>就是我们要找的真凶吗？

original: TYRION: He has to be.[p/] No one else could have orchestrated this entire plot.
translation: TYRION: 一定是他，[p/]除了他没有人能做到这一切。

original: You just need to find out how...[p/] and why.
translation: 你只需要弄明白他是怎么做到的……[p/]以及为什么要这样做。

original: TYRION: What was this meeting for?
translation: TYRION: 会面是为了什么？

original: THEODORE: Oh,[p/] nothing of note.
translation: THEODORE: 哦，[p/]没什么值得注意的。

original: THEODORE: We were merely discussing her daily operations and duties within the academy.
translation: THEODORE: 我们只是简单讨论了她在学院的日常工作和职责。

original: THEODORE: In an academy such as ours,[p/] it is beneficial to regularly communicate with the staff.
translation: THEODORE: 在我们这样的学院里，[p/]经常与员工沟通有助于学院发展。

original: TYRION: So, she showed up at [i]exactly[/i] 12:00 PM?
translation: TYRION: 所以说她<u>准时</u>在 12:00 赴约了？

original: THEODORE: More or less.
translation: THEODORE: 差不多吧。

original: THEODORE: Catherine Bellwether was many things,[p/] but she was never tardy.
translation: THEODORE: 凯瑟琳·贝尔维瑟可能有许多缺点，[p/]但她从不迟到。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: There aren’t any witnesses who saw her before the meeting.
translation: 在会面之前没有什么目击者看到她。

original: So, you don’t have a way to disprove what he’s saying.
translation: 所以没什么证据能证明他所说的有问题。

original: It’d be best to look elsewhere in his testimony.
translation: 最好关注一下他证言里的其他部分。

original: ARIA: How long did this meeting last, Headmaster?
translation: ARIA: 校长，请问这场会谈持续了多久？

original: TYRION: So that means the professor left your office at 1:00 PM?
translation: TYRION: 意思是教授在下午 1:00 离开了你的办公室？

original: THEODORE: Yes.[p/] She was quite adamant about taking time to prepare her lesson plans.
translation: THEODORE: 没错。[p/]她固执地要留出时间来备课。

original: Now that you think about it,[p/] Frega had no idea what the time was when she saw Bellwether.
translation: 这么说来，[p/]弗雷加不记得她是在什么时候遇到的贝尔维瑟。

original: If the headmaster [i]is[/i] lying about when the meeting ended,[p/] there’d be no way to verify it.
translation: 即使校长在会谈结束的时间上<u>说谎</u>，[p/]你也没有办法证明这一点。

original: Which would account for the “hour gap” that Steelwind mentioned.
translation: 这也就解释了斯蒂尔文德提到的“一小时间隔”。

original: Damn it…[p/] Did the headmaster really do this?
translation: 可恶……[p/]校长真的是凶手吗？

original: TYRION: After hearing so much about her…[p/] I find that a little hard to believe.
translation: TYRION: 了解了更多关于她的事之后……[p/]我发现有点难以相信。

original: THEODORE: ...I can see why you’d say that.
translation: THEODORE: ……我能明白你为什么这样说。

original: THEODORE: But despite everything,[p/] I was still her superior.
translation: THEODORE: 但抛开其他不谈，[p/]我仍是她的上级。

original: THEODORE: She always remained professional when speaking with me.
translation: THEODORE: 她在和我沟通时总是保持着专业风范。

original: Is that really true, though?
translation: 真的假的？

original: TYRION: Really?[p/] Even after the way she’s acted toward the students and faculty?
translation: TYRION: 真的吗？[p/]即使她对学生和教职员工是那种态度？

original: THEODORE: Make no mistake,[p/] I’ve heard many complaints regarding her actions.
translation: THEODORE: 不要误会，[p/]我收到过许多针对她行为的举报。

original: THEODORE: And I’ve had many conversations with her to try to correct her behavior.
translation: THEODORE: 我也和她谈过很多次，尝试纠正她的行为。

original: THEODORE: But at the end of the day,[p/] she [i]was[/i] a remarkable professor.
translation: THEODORE: 但归根结底，[p/]她<u>是</u>位出色的教授。

original: THEODORE: Regardless of her…[p/] lack of people skills.
translation: THEODORE: 虽然她缺少……[p/]人际交往的能力。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: CELESTE: His testimony pretty much matches what we know so far.
translation: CELESTE: 他的证言与我们所知的内容基本一致。

original: TYRION: I’m not entirely sure if he’s lying or not.
translation: TYRION: 我不太确定他是否在说谎。

original: TYRION: But at the very least,[p/] we know that he was involved in the professor’s murder.
translation: TYRION: 但至少，[p/]我们能确定他与教授的谋杀案有关。

original: TYRION: But…[p/] why?
translation: TYRION: 但……[p/]为什么？

original: If you can figure out his motive,[p/] you might be able to find out how to reveal him to the court.
translation: 如果你能找出他的作案动机，[p/]或许就能找到向法庭揭发他罪行的办法。

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生……我没看出来这两者有什么关系。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊、[p/]哦……[p/]好像是这样的。

original: TYRION: Redmond.[p/] Did you really hold no animosity toward Professor Bellwether?
translation: TYRION: 雷德蒙，[p/]你真的对贝尔维瑟教授没有敌意吗？

original: THEODORE: Of course not.
translation: THEODORE: 当然没有。

original: THEODORE: I [i]did[/i] have strong opinions about her…[p/] methods of teaching.
translation: THEODORE: 我<u>确实</u>有意见的，是她的……[p/]教学方式。

original: THEODORE: But I always remained professional.[p/] We both did.
translation: THEODORE: 但我一直在保持专业风范，[p/]我们都是。

original: TYRION: Frankly,[p/] I find that hard to believe.
translation: TYRION: 说实话，[p/]我很难相信这一点。

original: TYRION: In fact,[p/] I think you might have had a [i]very[/i] good reason to murder the professor.
translation: TYRION: 实际上，[p/]我倒是认为你有<u>强烈的</u>谋杀动机。

original: TYRION: …Considering that she was going to take your job.
translation: TYRION: ……因为她马上要取代你的校长位置。

original: ARIA: What…?
translation: ARIA: 什么……？

original: THEODORE: S-[p/][s/]So you knew about that…
translation: THEODORE: 所、[p/][s/]所以说你知道这件事……

original: ARIA: I’m sorry,[p/] but I don’t follow.
translation: ARIA: 不好意思，[p/]我没听明白。

original: ARIA: Just [i]how[/i] was the professor going to take the headmaster’s job?
translation: ARIA: 教授要<u>怎么</u>接替校长的职位呢？

original: TYRION: According to Miriam Frega,[p/] Catherine Bellwether was currying favor with the noble families.
translation: TYRION: 根据米莉亚姆·弗雷加所述，[p/]凯瑟琳·贝尔维瑟一直在巴结贵族。

original: TYRION: In fact,[p/] there was a plan to oust Mr. Redmond and appoint Bellwether as the new headmaster of the academy.
translation: TYRION: 实际上，[p/]最近贵族也计划罢免雷德蒙先生，并任命贝尔维瑟作为学院新校长。

original: ARIA: W-[p/][s/]What?!
translation: ARIA: 什、[p/][s/]什么？！

original: ARIA: …B-[p/][s/]But in any case,[p/] I doubt that the headmaster had [i]any[/i] idea of this until now.
translation: ARIA: ……但、[p/][s/]但无论如何，[p/]我认为校长直到现在才知道这件事。

original: TYRION: I’d like to remind the court of the witness’s reaction just now.
translation: TYRION: 我想请法庭回忆证人刚刚的反应。

original: TYRION: He said,[p/] “So you knew about that…”
translation: TYRION: 他说， [p/]“所以你知道这件事……”

original: TYRION: His reaction was one of surprise.
translation: TYRION: 他的反应确实很惊讶。

original: TYRION: But he wasn’t surprised [i]by[/i] this information.
translation: TYRION: 但他并非对这件事感到惊讶。

original: TYRION: He was surprised that I [i]knew[/i] this information!
translation: TYRION: 而是对我<u>知道</u>这件事而感到惊讶！

original: ARIA: T-[p/][s/]That’s-!
translation: ARIA: 这、[p/][s/]这简直——！

original: THEODORE: …Please,[p/] dear Aria.
translation: THEODORE: ……别这样，[p/]亲爱的阿莉亚。

original: THEODORE: I may be a frail old man,[p/] but I’m perfectly capable of defending myself.
translation: THEODORE: 我可能是个弱不禁风的老头子，[p/]但是我还有自己辩护的能力。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: TYRION: If you have an explanation Mr. Redmond,[p/] then by all means,[p/] I’d love to hear it.
translation: TYRION: 如果你对此有任何解释，雷德蒙先生，[p/]我洗耳恭听。

original: THEODORE: …Gladly.
translation: THEODORE: ……乐意至极。

original: Theodore: It [i]is[/i] true that I knew about the Fregas’ plot beforehand.[p/] But I had only [i]just[/i] learned about it.
translation: Theodore: 没错，我<u>的确</u>提前得知了弗雷加一族的计划，但也只是<u>最近</u>才知道。

original: Theodore: On the day of the murder,[p/] the professor told me about her plan.[p/] She was going to replace me as headmaster and replace the staff with her Arcane Constructs.
translation: Theodore: 案发当日，[p/]教授对我讲述了她的计划。[p/]她要代替我担任校长，用奥术构造体取代工作人员。

original: Theodore: Now you might say that this would have given me the perfect motive to murder the professor.
translation: Theodore: 各位或许会认为，这正好是我谋杀教授的动机。

original: Theodore: However,[p/] the supposed murder weapon was stolen from Ms. Frega.[p/] This happened weeks before the murder and my discovery of the professor’s treachery.
translation: Theodore: 但是，[p/]这把据称的凶器是弗雷加女士那里偷来的。[p/]这是谋杀案发生数周之前的事。那时我还不知道教授的如意算盘。

original: Theodore: I had no knowledge of their plan before she told me.[p/] And therefore,[p/] I wouldn’t have known to steal Ms. Frega’s weapon in an attempt to frame her.
translation: Theodore: 她告诉我之前，我并不知道他们的计划，[p/]更遑论为了陷害弗雷加女士，专门偷走她的武器了。

original: ARIA: Are you satisfied now, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: 你满意了吗，卡斯伯特先生？

original: ARIA: There is no way that the headmaster could have come up with this plan.
translation: ARIA: 校长不可能想出这个计划。

original: CELESTE: Hm…[p/] If he [i]really[/i] did do this,[p/] that means he stole the rapier too, right?
translation: CELESTE: 嗯……[p/]如果<u>真是</u>他下的手，[p/]就说明剑也是他偷的，对吧？

original: TYRION: …Most likely.
translation: TYRION: ……很有可能。

original: CELESTE: His alibi makes sense.[p/] He couldn’t have planned this whole thing unless he knew about Bellwether's plans.
translation: CELESTE: 他的不在场证明很合理。[p/]除非他事先就知道贝尔维瑟的打算，不然不可能计划周密。

original: CELESTE: That would mean he knew about this weeks ago.
translation: CELESTE: 那他几周前就该知道了。

original: CELESTE: But how did he even find out?
translation: CELESTE: 但他究竟是怎么发现的呢？

original: TYRION: The best way to tell a convincing lie is to leave a lot of truths and only change one detail.
translation: TYRION: 想撒谎撒得令人信服，最好的办法就是说真话，只改动其中一处细节。

original: TYRION: …Maybe Bellwether [i]did[/i] tell him.[p/] But she actually told him weeks ago.
translation: TYRION: ……说不定贝尔维瑟<u>确实</u>把计划告诉他了，[p/]在几周前就说了。

original: :The question is:[p/] how do you [i]prove[/i] that?
translation: :问题是：[p/]如何<u>证明</u>这一点？

original: JUDGE: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] You may begin your cross-examination.
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生，[p/]你可以开始交叉询问了。

original: TYRION: So, you only learned about it recently?
translation: TYRION: 你最近才知道吗？

original: TYRION: Doesn’t that seem a bit too convenient for you?
translation: TYRION: 时机是不是有点太巧了？

original: THEODORE: It may appear that way.[p/] Yes.
translation: THEODORE: 是有点巧。[p/]没错。

original: Theodore: But...
translation: Theodore: 不过……

original: TYRION: That must have infuriated you.
translation: TYRION: 你听了想必勃然大怒吧。

original: TYRION: Your colleague betrayed you [i]and[/i] attempted to steal your job.
translation: TYRION: 同事背叛了你，<u>而且</u>意图窃取你的校长之位。

original: THEODORE: I’m only human.[p/] Of course, I was taken aback.
translation: THEODORE: 我也是普通人，[p/]听了这话自然吃了一惊。

original: THEODORE: I’ve been headmaster of the Imperial Academy for decades.
translation: THEODORE: 我就任帝国学院校长已有数十年之久。

original: THEODORE: To think that the professor [i]and[/i] the board would go around my back like that.
translation: THEODORE: 教授<u>和</u>董事竟然会在我背后谋划这种事。

original: TYRION: With the professor dead,[p/] you won’t have to worry about losing your job.
translation: TYRION: 教授这么一死，[p/]你不用担心丢掉工作了。

original: TYRION: At least not for a while.
translation: TYRION: 至少这一阵子不用。

original: THEODORE: I suppose you’re correct.[p/] But there are others who benefit too.
translation: THEODORE: 我想你说得对。[p/]但也有其他人从中获益。

original: THEODORE: The faculty staff is now aware of the Fregas’ plot.
translation: THEODORE: 教职工们现在也知道了弗雷加的阴谋。

original: THEODORE: With her plot delayed,[p/] they won’t need to worry about abruptly losing their jobs either.
translation: THEODORE: 她的阴谋推迟了，[p/]他们也就不用担心自己哪一天突然丢了饭碗。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: …But what happens if you prove that Redmond is the killer?
translation: ……但如果你证明雷德蒙就是杀手又会发生什么？

original: He’ll lose his job [i]and[/i] House Frega will just appoint someone else…
translation: 他还是会丢掉校长的职位，<u>然后</u>弗雷加一族再指定另一个人……

original: No…[p/] You can't think about that now.
translation: 不行……[p/]你现在不能想这些。

original: If you don't prove Redmond's guilt,[p/] the court will convict Wallace.
translation: 如果你不能证明雷蒙德的罪行，[p/]法庭就会宣判华莱士有罪。

original: TYRION: As the headmaster,[p/] you’d probably have the tools available to get into her room.
translation: TYRION: 作为校长，[p/]你很可能有进入她房间的手段。

original: THEODORE: …Yes,[p/] I will admit that.
translation: THEODORE: ……没错，[p/]我承认这一点。

original: THEODORE: The academy has a master key that can be used to enter each of the students' dorms.
translation: THEODORE: 学院方有一把可以打开所有学生宿舍门的万能钥匙。

original: THEODORE: And yes,[p/] as headmaster,[p/] I would have access to that key.
translation: THEODORE: 并且确实，[p/]作为校长，[p/]我是可以拿到那把钥匙。

original: TYRION: Then you had the perfect way to get into her room [i]and[/i] steal the rapier undetected.
translation: TYRION: 那你就有闯进她的房间，<u>并且</u>不为人知地盗走刺剑的完美手法了。

original: THEODORE: I suppose I did.
translation: THEODORE: 我承认我确实有。

original: THEODORE: However,[p/] there’s one flaw with your logic.
translation: THEODORE: 然而，[p/]你的逻辑中有一处缺陷。

original: TYRION: It was my understanding that the Fregas wanted to keep this a secret until the very end.
translation: TYRION: 据我理解，弗雷加一族确实想把这个秘密藏到最后一刻。

original: TYRION: Why would Bellwether,[p/] of all people,[p/] tell you about her betrayal?
translation: TYRION: 为什么所有人之中[p/]，偏偏是贝尔维瑟来告诉你她的背叛行为呢？

original: THEODORE: I imagined she wanted to taunt me with that information.
translation: THEODORE: 我想过她可能是想用这个信息嘲讽我。

original: THEODORE: We’ve long had our disagreements and looking back,[p/] she may have resented me for that.
translation: THEODORE: 我们长期以来存在分岐，回首过往种种，[p/]她可能就是因此怨恨我。

original: THEODORE: And at that point,[p/] there wasn’t anything I could do to stop her.
translation: THEODORE: 到了那个时候，[p/]我已经没有什么制止她的方法。

original: TYRION: Really?[p/] I thought you and the professor were on good terms.
translation: TYRION: 真的吗？[p/]我还以为你和教授之间相处融洽呢。

original: THEODORE: I’d thought so too…[p/] But I suppose it was all a façade.
translation: THEODORE: 我原本也这么认为……[p/]但我想都只是表面功夫罢了。

original: THEODORE: She was just biding her time until she could take my position as headmaster.
translation: THEODORE: 她只是在等待时机取代我的校长之位。

original: CELESTE: He had to have known about Bellwether’s betrayal weeks ago.
translation: CELESTE: 他肯定几周前就知道了贝尔维瑟的背叛。

original: TYRION: Right…[p/] The question is:[p/] how do we prove it?
translation: TYRION: 是的……[p/]但问题是：[p/]怎么证明这一点？

original: CELESTE: Do we have something that proves he knew about it before the day of the murder?
translation: CELESTE: 我们有什么证据能证明，他在谋杀当日之前就知道了吗？

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生……我没看出来这两者有什么关系。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊、[p/]哦……[p/]好像是这样的。

original: TYRION: Redmond.[p/] You keep saying that you didn’t know about Bellwether’s plot before yesterday.
translation: TYRION: 雷德蒙。[p/]你一直在说昨天之前你都不知道贝尔维瑟的阴谋。

original: TYRION: Do you still plan on standing behind that claim?
translation: TYRION: 你还打算继续这个说法吗？

original: THEODORE: Of course, I am.[p/] Because it’s the truth.
translation: THEODORE: 是的，那当然。[p/]因为事实如此。

original: TYRION: I’m sorry, Redmond.[p/] But you should really close your doors during your meetings.
translation: TYRION: 那我很抱歉，雷德蒙。[p/]但你应该在与人会面时把门关好。

original: THEODORE: W-[p/][s/]What…? [mind="…Did someone see?!"/]
translation: THEODORE: 怎、[p/][s/]怎么会……？[mind="……有人看到了？！"/]

original: TYRION: It [i]is[/i] true that Bellwether revealed her plan to you during one of your meetings.
translation: TYRION: 贝尔维瑟在与你的一次会面中揭明了她的计划，<u>这是事实</u>。

original: TYRION: In fact,[p/] Jan Hughes happened to overhear that same meeting.
translation: TYRION: 实际上，[p/]简·休斯无意中听到了那一次对话。

original: TYRION: But he only overheard the part where the staff would be replaced.
translation: TYRION: 但他只听到了教职工们会被替换的那一部分。

original: THEODORE: …!
translation: THEODORE: ……！

original: TYRION: And that's the strangest part, Redmond.
translation: TYRION: 这才是最奇怪的地方，雷德蒙先生。

original: TYRION: According to Mr. Hughes, this meeting…
translation: TYRION: 根据休斯先生的证言，这场会面……

original: TYRION: …Occurred weeks ago!
translation: TYRION: ……发生在几周之前！

original: ARIA: You can’t accuse the headmaster of perjury based on a rumor!
translation: ARIA: 你不能因为道听途说，就指控校长在作伪证！

original: ARIA: Everything you’ve just said is based on second-hand information!
translation: ARIA: 你所说的一切都只是基于二手信息！

original: TYRION: Mr. Hughes [i]distinctly[/i] overheard that the staff would be replaced with Arcane Constructs.
translation: TYRION: 休斯先生<u>清楚地</u>听到，教职员工都会被替换成奥术构造体。

original: TYRION: That is [i]too[/i] specific and [i]too[/i] accurate to assume that he misheard a different conversation.
translation: TYRION: 如果只是听错的话，不可能<u>这么</u>具体准确。

original: ARIA: The professor probably only revealed her plan for the Arcane Constructs.
translation: ARIA: 教授可能只是揭露了有关奥术构造体的计划。

original: ARIA: That [i]still[/i] doesn’t prove that he knew about her treachery beforehand.
translation: ARIA: 这<u>还是</u>没办法证明校长提前知晓教授的背叛。

original: TYRION: Professor Bellwether had no authority over the cleaning staff’s employment.
translation: TYRION: 贝尔维瑟教授无权决定清洁人员的去留。

original: TYRION: It wouldn’t make sense for her to [i]just[/i] reveal her plan for the Arcane Constructs.
translation: TYRION: 没道理<u>只</u>揭露她计划中关于奥术构造体的部分。

original: TYRION: That would only make sense if he knew that Bellwether would be taking his job.
translation: TYRION: 只有一种可能说得通：校长知道贝尔维瑟会取代自己的职位。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: Tyrion: So, tell me one thing, Redmond.
translation: Tyrion: 所以，告诉我，雷德蒙校长。

original: TYRION: Why did you find the need to lie about this?
translation: TYRION: 为什么你选择在这里说谎？

original: TYRION: Is it because you saw a need to protect yourself from my accusations?
translation: TYRION: 是因为你觉得有必要保护自己免受我的控告吗？

original: THEODORE: …
translation: THEODORE: ……

original: TYRION: Redmond.[p/] I asked you a question.
translation: TYRION: 雷德蒙，[p/]我有个问题。

original: TYRION: [i]Did[/i] you murder Catherine Bellwether?
translation: TYRION: 凯瑟琳·贝尔维瑟是被<u>你</u>杀害的吗？

original: THEODORE: Hm…
translation: THEODORE: 哼姆……

original: THEODORE: What a fine mess this is… [mind="I’m not done… Not yet…"/]
translation: THEODORE: 真是一团糟啊…… [mind="我还没完……还没……"/]

original: ARIA: …H-[p/][s/]Headmaster?!
translation: ARIA: ……校、[p/][s/]校长？！

original: THEODORE: So,[p/] you truly plan on pushing this,[p/] are you?
translation: THEODORE: 所以说，[p/]你是真的打算一条路走到黑，[p/]对吧？

original: THEODORE: Well,[p/] your thesis [i]sounded[/i] promising, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: THEODORE: 好吧，[p/]你的论点<u>听起来</u>很有趣，卡斯伯特先生。

original: THEODORE: But I believe your arguments could use a little work.
translation: THEODORE: 但我认为你的论点还需要稍加修正。

original: No...[p/] That's not right.
translation: 不……[p/]不对。

original: You have the evidence to knowledge to disprove his claims.
translation: 你有证据来反驳他的声明。

original: OK
translation: OK

original: Theodore: You think I killed Catherine Bellwether?[p/][s/] Me?!
translation: Theodore: 你认为是我杀了凯瑟琳·贝尔维瑟？[p/][s/]我？！

original: Theodore: I am an elderly man in his late 80’s.
translation: Theodore: 我已经是个年近九十的老头子了。

original: Theodore: I can barely walk,[p/] much less wield a rapier.
translation: Theodore: 我都快要走不动了，[p/]更别提使用刺剑了。

original: Tyrion: But you and Bellwether weren’t the only people in that room, were you?
translation: Tyrion: 但房间里可不止有你和贝尔维瑟，不是吗？

original: Tyrion: You needed the Arcane Construct to carry Bellwether’s body.
translation: Tyrion: 你需要奥术构造体来搬运贝尔维瑟的尸体。

original: Tyrion: That means that the Construct would have already been in your office.
translation: Tyrion: 那个奥术构造体肯定已经在你的办公室里了。

original: Tyrion: And with your privileges,[p/] you could have easily programmed the Construct to stab Bellwether for you.
translation: Tyrion: 以你的权限，[p/]你可以轻松命令奥术构造体替你杀害贝尔维瑟。

original: Theodore: …!
translation: Theodore: ……！

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: He's technically correct.[p/] There's no way he could have overpowered Bellwether by himself.
translation: 严格上来说没错，[p/]他确实没办法一个人制服贝尔维瑟。

original: But was he [i]really[/i] by himself?
translation: 但他<u>真的</u>只是一个人吗？

original: Theodore: E-[p/]Even so,[p/] think about what would have transpired afterward.
translation: Theodore: 即、[p/]即便如此，[p/]想想之后发生了什么。

original: Theodore: Recall,[p/] Ms. Steelwind’s timeline of Bellwether’s witnesses.
translation: Theodore: 请回想一下斯蒂尔文德女士所列，有关贝尔维瑟被目击的时间线。

original: Theodore: With your theory,[p/] the Construct would have spent more than [i]an hour[/i] in the library.
translation: Theodore: 根据你的理论，[p/]奥术构造体会在图书馆停留超过<u>一小时</u>。

original: Theodore: Having it there would have risked my so-called ruse from being discovered. [mind="Luckily, Lady Frega can’t tell night from day."/]
translation: Theodore: 如果把它放在那里，我那所谓的诡计就有可能会被识破。[mind="还好还好，还好弗雷加小姐昼夜不分。"/]

original: TYRION: The timing deduced from Ms. Frega’s testimony is predicated on one thing.
translation: TYRION: 根据弗雷加女士的证言推断出的时间有个前提。

original: TYRION: She saw Ms. Bellwether exit your office after your meeting.
translation: TYRION: 她看见了贝尔维瑟女士在会面结束后离开你的办公室。

original: TYRION: However,[p/] if we assume that you’re [i]lying[/i] about when this “meeting” ended,[p/] your entire argument falls apart.
translation: TYRION: 然而，[p/]如果我们假定你在这次“会谈”的结束时间上<u>说了谎</u>，[p/]你的整个主张就将分崩离析。

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega would have encountered Bellwether after her death at 2:01 PM.
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士就是在下午 2:01，贝尔维瑟死后遇到了她。

original: THEODORE: M-[p/][s/]Ms. Frega wouldn’t have made a mistake like that!
translation: THEODORE: 弗、[p/][s/]弗雷加女士才不会犯这样的错误！

original: TYRION: Ms. Frega thought it was [i]morning[/i] when she saw Bellwether!
translation: TYRION: 弗雷加女士看到贝尔维瑟的时候，还以为当时是<u>上午</u>！

original: TYRION: She can’t reliably tell the time!
translation: TYRION: 她对时间的记忆并不准确！

original: Theodore: ...!
translation: Theodore: ……！

original: Tyrion: Redmond,[p/] what you’re saying clearly doesn’t match with what you’re thinking.
translation: Tyrion: 雷德蒙。[p/]你所说的和你所想的明显不一致。

original: Theodore: What kind of weak assertion is that?!
translation: Theodore: 你这是什么无力的主张？！

original: Theodore: How could you [i]possibly[/i] know what I'm thinking?
translation: Theodore: 你怎么<u>可能</u>知道我在想什么？

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh, um...
translation: Tyrion: 呃、[p/]哦，嗯……

original: You need to choose your words more carefully.
translation: 你需要更谨慎地选择用词。

original: No one else knows about the Eye of Horus.
translation: 没有其他人知道荷鲁斯之眼。

original: Theodore: T-[p/][s/]Then what about where the rapier was placed?!
translation: Theodore: 那、[p/][s/]那关于刺剑被遗落的地方呢？！

original: Theodore: If I really [i]was[/i] the murderer,[p/] then that would mean I planted the weapon in young [i]Wallace’s[/i] locker!
translation: Theodore: 如果我<u>真的是</u>凶手，[p/]就意味着是我把武器放在了<u>华莱士的</u>储物柜里！

original: Theodore: Several of the students had lockers there that I had access to.
translation: Theodore: 我还能打开其他几个学生的储物柜。

original: Theodore: Wallace is one of my prized students.[p/][s/] If I had to frame anyone,[p/][s/] he would be the last person I chose!
translation: Theodore: 华莱士是我的爱徒之一。[p/][s/]如果我一定要陷害谁，[p/][s/]最不可能选的就是他！

original: Tyrion: You’re right, Mr. Redmond.
translation: Tyrion: 你说得对，雷德蒙先生。

original: Tyrion: You wouldn’t try to frame Wallace.
translation: Tyrion: 你不会陷害华莱士。

original: Tyrion: But you [i]would[/i] try to frame Miriam Frega.
translation: Tyrion: 但你<u>会</u>尝试陷害米莉亚姆·弗雷加。

original: Theodore: …!
translation: Theodore: ……！

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: He wouldn't have [i]intentionally[/i] framed Wallace.
translation: 他不会<u>故意</u>陷害华莱士。

original: Something must have confused him about whose locker he placed the rapier in.
translation: 在选择把刺剑放进哪个储物柜的时候，他肯定被什么东西误导了。

original: Tyrion: It would have been the perfect act of revenge, wouldn’t it?
translation: Tyrion: 真是一场完美的复仇剧，不是吗？

original: Tyrion: You murder your treacherous co-worker [i]and[/i] frame the daughter of the family that helped her!
translation: Tyrion: 你杀掉那个背信弃义的同事，<u>同时</u>又嫁祸给支持她家族的千金！

original: Tyrion: But something went wrong, didn’t it Redmond?
translation: Tyrion: 但有个地方出了问题，不是吗雷德蒙？

original: Tyrion: The labels on Wallace’s locker and Miriam’s locker were switched.
translation: Tyrion: 华莱士和米莉亚姆储物柜上的名牌被交换了。

original: Tyrion: Anyone who saw that would have easily mixed them up.
translation: Tyrion: 看到名牌的人都会混淆二者。

original: Theodore: I am the [i]headmaster[/i] of the Imperial Academy!
translation: Theodore: 我是这座帝国学院的<u>校长</u>！

original: Theodore: I have records of all the students’ lockers and where they’re located!
translation: Theodore: 我有所有学生的储物柜及其位置的记录！

original: Theodore: If I truly planned this,[p/][s/] I would have [i]known[/i] where Wallace’s locker was!
translation: Theodore: 如果我真的谋划了这一切，[p/][s/]我会<u>记住</u>华莱士的储物柜在哪里！

original: Theodore: A simple change in labels wouldn’t have led me to make a careless mistake like that!
translation: Theodore: 简单换个标签才不会让我犯下这么粗心的错误！

original: TYRION: But it wasn’t you, was it?
translation: TYRION: 但并非你自己动手，不是吗？

original: TYRION: Your Arcane Construct was the one who planted the rapier in the locker.
translation: TYRION: 把刺剑放入储物柜的是你的奥术构造体。

original: THEODORE: …!
translation: THEODORE: ……！

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: He would have noticed if the locker IDs were switched.
translation: 他自己会注意到储物柜的名牌被交换了。

original: But this is all based on the assumption that [i]he[/i] was the person that planted the rapier.
translation: 但这基于是<u>他本人</u>放置了那把刺剑的前提。

original: TYRION: I bet you commanded it to “place this rapier in the locker of Miriam Frega”.
translation: TYRION: 我敢打赌，是你命令它“将这把刺剑放到米莉亚姆·弗雷加的储物柜里”。

original: TYRION: But it saw the ID number on Wallace’s locker and assumed that it was Miriam’s.
translation: TYRION: 但它看到华莱士的储物柜上的名牌，就认为这是米莉亚姆的。

original: THEODORE: T-[p/][s/]This is…![p/][s/] I-[p/][s/]I…!
translation: THEODORE: 这、[p/][s/]这是……！[p/][s/]我、[p/][s/]我……！

original: Redmond begins desperately stammering,[p/] looking for something to say.
translation: 雷德蒙急得结结巴巴的，[p/]看起来还在寻找说辞。

original: THEODORE: Ms. Steelwind,[p/][s/] say something!
translation: THEODORE: 斯蒂尔文德女士。[p/][s/]说些什么啊！

original: ARIA: ...What?![p/][s/] I…
ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: Agh!
translation: ARIA: 啊！

original: Aria: Mr. Cuthbert![p/][s/] Your theory may be plausible but there’s no evidence to support it!
translation: Aria: 卡斯伯特先生！[p/][s/]你的说法可能有道理，但没有证据支持！

original: THEODORE: …!
translation: THEODORE: ……！

original: THEODORE: Ha![p/][s/] That’s right![p/][s/] You don’t have any proof, do you?!
translation: THEODORE: 哈！[p/][s/]没错！[p/][s/]你没有任何证据，不是吗？

original: THEODORE: Saying that I could have committed the murder isn’t the same as proving I did it!
translation: THEODORE: 陈述我有实施谋杀的可能性，和证明我确实做了，可根本不是一回事！

original: Tyrion: Your Arcane Construct is [i]still[/i] in the locker room where it planted the rapier!
translation: Tyrion: 你的奥术构造体<u>仍然</u>待在放置刺剑的储物柜室！

original: Tyrion: All we have to do is take a look inside it and we’ll see the blood inside!
translation: Tyrion: 只要调查构造体内部，我们就会看到里面的血迹！

original: THEODORE: Is that so, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: THEODORE: 是这样吗，卡斯伯特先生？

original: What...?[p/] Why does he still look so confident?
translation: 什么……？[p/]他为何看起来还这么自信？

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: Wasn't there some sort of evidence that would track the orders given to him?
translation: 有没有什么证据记录了构造体获得的指令？

original: ARIA: No…![p/] Mr. Cuthbert…[p/] I…
translation: ARIA: 没有……！[p/]卡斯伯特先生……[p/]我……

original: ARIA: I already checked the inside of that Construct during my investigation.
translation: ARIA: 我在调查过程中查看过构造体的内部。

original: ARIA: The interior was completely clean.
translation: ARIA: 里面一尘不染。

original: TYRION: What?!
translation: TYRION: 不会吧？！

original: THEODORE: The Constructs’ primary function is to assist and [i]clean[/i], dear Tyrion!
translation: THEODORE: 构造体的主要功能就是辅助和<u>清洁</u>，我亲爱的提利昂！

original: THEODORE: They have a function that allows them to clean [i]themselves[/i],[p/][s/] inside and out!
translation: THEODORE: 它们本身就有清洁<u>自身</u>的机能，[p/][s/]外表和内部皆有！

original: TYRION: W-[p/][s/]Well,[p/] we can still look at its command history, right?!
translation: TYRION: 好、[p/][s/]好吧，[p/]但我们还是可以检查它的指令记录，对吧？！

original: ARIA: …Think about it, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: ARIA: ……仔细想想，卡斯伯特先生。

original: ARIA: Do you honestly think that the murderer would leave behind evidence like that?
translation: ARIA: 你真的觉得凶手会留下这样的证据吗？

original: ARIA: …I’m sure that [i]whoever[/i] orchestrated this plot,[p/] they ordered the Construct to wipe its logs when it was finished.
translation: ARIA: ……我很肯定，<u>不论是谁</u>精心策划了这场阴谋，[p/]他们都会命令构造体删除历史记录。

original: TYRION: N-[p/][s/]No…
translation: TYRION: 不、[p/][s/]不……

original: THEODORE: That’s right, Mr. Cuthbert!
translation: THEODORE: 就是这样，卡斯伯特先生！

original: THEODORE: Your case against me is theoretical at best!
translation: THEODORE: 你对我的指控只有状况证据！

original: THEODORE: But I suppose I can still give you marks for trying!
translation: THEODORE: 至少你的尝试精神可嘉！

original: Damn it![p/][s/] He thought of everything!
translation: 该死的！[p/][s/]他考虑很周全！

original: Was he seriously able to get rid of all the evidence?!
translation: 他真的处理掉了所有证据吗？！

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: You’re running out of options.
translation: 你快黔驴技穷了。

original: But…[p/] you still have [i]one[/i] tool left.
translation: 但是……[p/]你还有<u>一个</u>手段。

original: THEODORE: …Ha![p/] It’s unbecoming to glare like that, young Tyrion!
translation: THEODORE: ……哈！[p/]那样瞪着我很没礼貌啊，年轻人！

original: ARIA: …? [mind="He's doing it again..."/]
translation: ARIA: ……？[mind="他又在这么干了……"/]

original: Bring yourself back to that moment with Garrick Pierce.
translation: 回想你与加里克·皮尔斯对峙的那个瞬间。

original: Think about what’s at stake for Wallace,[p/] just like you did with Celeste.
translation: 想一想性命攸关的华莱士，[p/]就像塞莱斯特的审理那时一样。

original: His life and his future are in your hands.
translation: 他的命与未来都要靠你。

original: You activated the Empowered Eye again.
translation: 你再一次激活了强化之眼。

original: Redmond did a good job of covering his tracks…
translation: 雷德蒙很好地掩盖了行踪……

original: But there has to be something that he forgot to get rid of!
translation: 但他肯定会忘掉什么东西！

original: Theodore: I can't believe I let this boy push me this far...
translation: Theodore: 我真不敢相信，这个小伙子能把我逼到这个地步……

original: Theodore: I was too careless...[p/] I should have been [i]much[/i] more wary of him.
translation: Theodore: 我太大意了……[p/]我应该对他<u>更加</u>警惕。

original: Theodore: Agh...[p/] My head...
translation: Theodore: 啊……[p/]我的脑袋……

original: Theodore: The stress from this trial must be giving me a migraine...
translation: Theodore: 庭审带来的压力让我犯偏头痛了……

original: That's strange...[p/] Why can't you make him think about Eris?
translation: 好奇怪……[p/]你为什么不能让他思考厄莉斯的事情？

original: Well,[p/] you suppose that it doesn't matter.
translation: 算了，[p/]应该也不重要。

original: Theodore: It's all Tymora's fault that I'm even here...
translation: Theodore: 我现在会在这里，都是泰摩拉的错……

original: Theodore: If it weren't for my debts,[p/] that boy would have never even [i]met[/i] Wallace.
translation: Theodore: 如果不是我的债务，[p/]那个小子永远不会<u>遇见</u>华莱士。

original: Theodore: I can't believe I put myself into this mess for [i]Bellwether[/i] of all people...
translation: Theodore: 我真不敢相信自己会为了<u>贝尔维瑟</u>卷入这堆破事……

original: Theodore: ...
translation: Theodore: ……

original: Theodore: ...Why do I feel remorse for her?
translation: Theodore: ……我为何因她产生悔意？

original: Theodore: She [i]deserved[/i] what happened to her.
translation: Theodore: 她根本就是<u>罪有应得</u>。

original: Theodore: I wasn't just thinking of myself...
translation: Theodore: 我并不是只为了自己考虑……

original: Theodore: The staff...[p/][s/] Bellwether would have thrown them onto the [i]street[/i] if not for what I did!
translation: Theodore: 那些教职工……[p/][s/]如果我不动手，贝尔维瑟就会让他们所有人<u>流落街头</u>！

original: Theodore: This is all the nobility's fault!
translation: Theodore: 这都是贵族们的错！

original: Theodore: This [i]whole[/i] time they were plotting to throw me out.
translation: Theodore: <u>这段时间</u>他们一直在密谋赶我下台。

original: Theodore: It's [i]their[/i] fault that Bellwether is dead![p/][s/] Not mine!
translation: Theodore: 贝尔维瑟的死都怪<u>他们</u>！[p/][s/]不怪我！

original: Theodore: Her blood is on the hands of the Fregas [i]and[/i] the Steelwinds.
translation: Theodore: 害死她的是弗雷加<u>和</u>斯蒂尔文德两家贵族。

original: Theodore: I wonder...[p/] Did I leave any other pieces of evidence behind?
translation: Theodore: 我在想……[p/]我还留下了其他证据吗？

original: Theodore: I was far too reckless...
translation: Theodore: 我太鲁莽了……

original: Theodore: But I needed [i]some[/i] way to keep that lecture hall empty.
translation: Theodore: 但我需要<u>某种</u>让那个讲堂空无一人的方法。

original: Oh, right.[p/] He must have botched the alchemy experiment on purpose to keep the lecture hall cleared.
translation: 噢，对啊。[p/]他是故意搞砸了那个炼金实验，来确保讲堂里没有人。

original: But that doesn't really tell you anything you can use right now.
translation: 但这也不能告诉你现在能出示什么。

original: Theodore: I had to do everything I could to shift guilt away from myself.
translation: Theodore: 为了让自己洗脱嫌疑，我使出了一切手段。

original: Theodore: ...But did I leave any holes in my alibi?
translation: Theodore: ……但我的不在场证明有留下什么漏洞吗？

original: Theodore: No...[p/] I accounted for everything.
translation: Theodore: 没有吧……[p/]每个方面我都算计过了。

original: Theodore: There's [i]no[/i] way I left any evidence behind.
translation: Theodore: 我<u>不可能</u>留下任何证据。

original: Theodore: ...My [b]illusion[/b] should have been flawless.
translation: Theodore: ……我的[b]幻象术[/b]是无懈可击的。

original: Theodore: I can't believe this boy was able to deduce what happened.
translation: Theodore: 我不敢相信，这小伙子能推理出发生的事情。

original: Theodore: I did everything I could to cast doubt on Frega's brat.
translation: Theodore: 我使劲浑身解数栽赃弗雷加家的小孩儿。

original: Theodore: I can't believe Valerie placed a trace of [b]necromancy[/b] on the body.
translation: Theodore: 我不敢相信瓦莱丽在尸体上留下了[b]死灵术[/b]的魔法痕迹。

original: Theodore: To make matters worse,[p/] the Construct placed the evidence in the wrong locker.
translation: Theodore: 更糟的是，[p/]那个构造体把物证放在了错误的柜子里。

original: So, he [i]did[/i] send the Construct to the locker room to plant the evidence.
translation: 所以，他<u>确实</u>有让构造体把物证放在储物柜里。

original: He must have also fabricated the documents that accused Frega of cheating.
translation: 他肯定还伪造了指控弗雷加作弊的文件。

original: It was all to make [i]her[/i] look like the murderer.
translation: 这都是为了让<u>她</u>看起来像凶手。

original: But this doesn't give you anything new to work with.
translation: 但这些并没有提供任何新线索。

original: Theodore: Why was the Construct in the locker room though...?
translation: Theodore: 为什么那个构造体最后会留在储物柜室呢……？

original: Theodore: It shouldn't have been there if it had followed my orders.
translation: Theodore: 按照我的指令，它不应该留在那里。

original: Theodore: No matter...[p/] It wiped its logs.
translation: Theodore: 不过没关系了……[p/]它已经抹除了日志。

original: Theodore: They have nothing on me.
translation: Theodore: 他们没有指向我的证据了。

original: So, he [i]did[/i] order it to wipe its logs...
translation: 所以，他<u>确实</u>命令了构造体删除自身的日志……

original: In order to cover all of its tracks,[p/] it probably would have done this last.
translation: 并以此掩盖它的行踪，[p/]这大概率是最后一条指令。

original: Theodore: The Construct's orders were clear.
translation: Theodore: 对构造体的指令很明确。

original: Theodore: Plant the body in Lecture Hall 2-B.
translation: Theodore: 把尸体放到 2-B 讲堂里。

original: Theodore: And then plant the evidence in Frega's locker.
translation: Theodore: 然后把证据放进弗雷加的储物柜。

original: Theodore: It was [i]supposed[/i] to head to the Storage Room afterward.
translation: Theodore: 之后它<u>本应</u>回到储藏室。

original: Theodore: What happened?
translation: Theodore: 到底发生了什么？

original: Interesting...[p/] The Construct wasn't [i]supposed[/i] to be in the Locker Room?
translation: 这就有意思了……[p/]那个构造体<u>不应该</u>在储物柜室里？

original: Theodore: …?
translation: Theodore: ……？

original: Theodore: Why am I thinking of this [i]now[/i]?
translation: Theodore: 我为什么<u>现在</u>在想这个？

original: Hm…[p/] That piece of evidence didn’t evoke any useful thoughts from him.
translation: 唔……[p/]那份证据没能让他产生什么有用的想法。

original: Trying PROJECTING something related to the Construct's actions.
translation: 尝试<size=1.5em>“投影”</size>与构造体的行动有关的事物。

original: There's nothing here for you to use.[p/] You should try something else.
translation: 这没什么可以供你利用的，[p/]你应该试试别的。

original: Wait…[p/] He ordered the Construct to go to the Storage Room?
translation: 等下……[p/]他曾命令过奥术构造体前往储藏室？

original: It would have done that [i]after[/i] it was finished planting evidence in the locker room.
translation: 它本应在储物柜里放下物证<u>之后</u>离开的。

original: But we [i]found[/i] it in the Locker Room…
translation: 但我们是在储物柜室里<u>找到</u>它的……

original: No…[p/] That’s not right.
translation: 不对……[p/]再好好想想。

original: Redmond clearly didn't intend for the Construct to end up in the Locker Room.
translation: 雷蒙德的本意明显不是让奥术构造体最后留在储物柜室里。

original: Someone or something must have interfered with it.
translation: 某人或某物一定干扰了它。

original: Right…[p/] The body was probably reported earlier than Redmond expected.
translation: 没错……[p/]尸体被发现并被报告的时间，可能要早于雷德蒙所预料的时间。

original: This means he probably started the lockdown [i]before[/i] the Construct was finished in the Locker Room.
translation: 说明他很大概率在奥术构造体完成位于储物柜室的任务<u>之前</u>，就被迫启动了封锁。

original: But does this change anything?
translation: 但这会改变什么吗？

original: No...[p/] The lockdown prevented the Construct from leaving the Locker Room.
translation: 不对……[p/]封锁阻止了奥术构造体离开储物柜室。

original: Would that have affected any of the elements at play during this time?
translation: 这会影响到这段时间里的什么因素吗？

original: Right...[p/] The series of commands would have been interrupted…
translation: 对……[p/]一系列指令会被干扰……

original: Wait a minute!
translation: 等下！

original: MIRIAM: Constructs execute a series of commands in the order that they are given.
translation: MIRIAM: 奥术构造体会按照顺序，执行收到的一系列指令。

original: MIRIAM: But let’s say one of those tasks is impossible to complete.
translation: MIRIAM: 但我们假设其中有些任务是无法完成的。

original: MIRIAM: When the Construct gets to that task,[p/] it will deem the entire series impossible to complete.
translation: MIRIAM: 当奥术构造体开始执行无法完成的任务时，[p/]它会认定整套命令都无法执行。

original: MIRIAM: As a result,[p/] it will stop executing the series altogether.
translation: MIRIAM: 结果就是，[p/]它会停止执行全部任务。

original: CSteel: So if a task in a series of commands is impossible,[p/] then that command will interrupt the entire series.
translation: CSteel: 也就是说如果一系列任务中之一无法完成，[p/]那么这个任务会中断后续任务的进行。

original: The Construct’s [i]final[/i] command was to wipe its memory…
translation: 那个奥术构造体的<u>最后一项</u>任务是抹除自身的操作日志……

original: But if its orders were interrupted by the lockdown then-!
translation: 但如果指令之一被封锁干扰的话——！

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: TYRION: Ms. Steelwind,[p/] I have nothing more to ask this witness.
translation: TYRION: 斯蒂尔文德女士，[p/]我没有要向证人询问的问题了。

original: Aria: What?!
translation: Aria: 什么？！

original: CELESTE: …
translation: CELESTE: ……

original: CELESTE: You’re not giving up, are you?
translation: CELESTE: 你还没放弃对吧？

original: TYRION: Do you even have to ask?
translation: TYRION: 这你还用问？

original: CELESTE: Yeah…[p/] I thought so.
translation: CELESTE: 嗯……[p/]我想也是。

original: Celeste: But how are you going to prove he did it if he’s not testifying?
translation: Celeste: 但如果他不继续出庭作证，你该怎么证明他是真凶呢？

original: TYRION: Don’t worry.[p/] The next witness’s testimony will be all I need.
translation: TYRION: 别担心，[p/]只要下一个证人的证言就足够了。

original: CELESTE: "Next" witness?
translation: CELESTE: “下一个”证人？

original: ARIA: ...
translation: ARIA: ……

original: Aria: That look on your face isn’t one of defeat…[p/] Just what are you planning?
translation: Aria: 你脸上不像是败者的神情……[p/]你到底在盘算着什么？

original: THEODORE: Ha![p/][s/] It’s nothing but desperate bravado.
translation: THEODORE: 哈！[p/][s/]不过是深陷绝望之中的垂死挣扎罢了。

original: THEODORE: Now,[p/] if you’ll excuse me…
translation: THEODORE: 现在，[p/]恕我失陪……

original: ARIA: ...You’ve let your quarry get away, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: ARIA: ……卡斯伯特先生，你在让自己的猎物溜走。

original: ARIA: I hope you know what you’re doing.
translation: ARIA: 我希望你清楚自己在干什么。

original: TYRION: I do, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: TYRION: 我很清楚，斯蒂尔文德女士。

original: TYRION: First,[p/] I’d like for the Inquisition to bring in the Arcane Construct in the academy’s locker room.
translation: TYRION: 首先，[p/]我想请裁判所将位于学院储物柜室里的奥术构造体带到法庭上来。

original: ARIA: We’ve already established that the murderer could have wiped its history.
translation: ARIA: 我们已经证明了真凶可能清除它的历史记录。

original: TYRION: Please…[p/] Just humor me for a second, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: TYRION: 别这样……[p/]斯蒂尔文德女士，这次你就稍微配合我一下。

original: ARIA: …Very well.
translation: ARIA: ……好吧。

original: ARIA: Bailiff,[p/] please relay Mr. Cuthbert's request to Commander White.
translation: ARIA: 法警，[p/]请将卡斯伯特先生的要求传达给怀特指挥官。

original: Aria: Well...[p/] Here's your Construct.
translation: Aria: 好了……[p/]这就是你要的那个奥术构造体。

original: Aria: I hope you know what you're doing, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Aria: 你最好知道自己在干什么，卡斯伯特先生。

original: TYRION: Construct!
translation: TYRION: 奥术构造体！

original: Arcane: WHAT ARE YOUR ORDERS?
translation: Arcane: <size=1.5em>你有什么指令？</size>

original: TYRION: Please recite your command history.
translation: TYRION: 请复述你的历史指令。

original: Arcane: REPORTING.
translation: Arcane: <size=1.5em>汇报中。</size>

original: Arcane: COMMAND 1:[p/] STANDBY IN \[Headmaster’s Office\].
translation: Arcane: <size=1.5em>命令1：[p/]在\[校长办公室\]待命。</size>

original: Arcane: COMMAND 2:[p/] AWAIT VOCAL SIGNAL \[“Attack!”\] FROM \[Theodore Redmond\].
translation: Arcane: <size=1.5em>命令2：[p/]等待\[西奥多·雷德蒙\]的\[“攻击！”\]声音信号。</size>

original: You hear Redmond stand up from the gallery.
translation: 你听见雷德蒙从旁听席上站了起来。

original: Seeing this,[p/] the prosecutor watches him and carefully clutches the handle of her cane.
translation: 注意到他的动作，[p/]检察官盯着他，同时紧握着自己的手杖。

original: Arcane: COMMAND 3:[p/] TREAT \[Catherine Bellwether\] AS A HOSTILE ENTITY AND NEUTRALIZE.
